definition: (of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to remarry (of widow)/to pass on (blame, cost, obligation, unpleasant consequence etc)/to transfer (blame, guilt)/to pass the buck
to graft (a branch to a rootstock)
(of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
(of a woman) to marry a non-local or foreigner
If you marry a chicken, follow the chicken (idiom); A woman should follow whatever her husband orders./We must learn to accept the people around us.

sentences.english: It is divided into two parts: principal structure and ecological structure.
sentences.chinese: 哭嫁歌分爲主體結構和生態結構兩個部分。

sentences.english: Mothers-in-law hasten sons-in-law to buy houses, thus they may assure before their daughters getting married.
sentences.chinese: 丈母孃督促小女婿快點買房，這樣才放心嫁女兒。

sentences.english: I'm afraid my sister married a real wimp.
sentences.chinese: 我看我的妹妹大概是嫁了一個真正的軟骨頭。

sentences.english: Ming Fei and Hu children married early, felt two hundred cars were Orchid.
sentences.chinese: 明妃初嫁與胡兒，氈車百兩皆胡姬。

sentences.english: The Lan Hui in the idea noodles disdains to and worried, panic the surname in annual to really marry to come in.
sentences.chinese: 瀾惠心裏面既不屑又焦急，生怕年氏真嫁進來。

sentences.english: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.
sentences.chinese: 妻子若離棄丈夫另嫁，也是犯奸淫了。

sentences.english: I now give it to you, if you are resolved on having him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你現在已經決定了要嫁他，我當然決計允許你。

sentences.english: Why had she married into the Chiang family?
sentences.chinese: 當初她爲什麼嫁到姜家來？

sentences.english: She did not want to marry a man who simply wanted to marry a veiling , practicing Muslim.
sentences.chinese: 她不想嫁一個只想與戴蓋頭實踐的穆斯林結婚的人。

sentences.english: Part of the reason Indians favor sons is the enormous expense in marrying off girls.
sentences.chinese: 印度人這麼喜歡兒子的部分原因是嫁掉女兒太費錢。

sentences.english: 12And if she divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.
sentences.chinese: 妻子若離棄丈夫另嫁，也是犯奸淫了。

sentences.english: She married into a prominent family.
sentences.chinese: 她嫁到一個顯赫的家族。

sentences.english: A flower that she only married a hero.
sentences.chinese: 一枝花笑稱她一生只嫁英雄。

sentences.english: Girls grow up only to marry into somebody else’s family and bear children.
sentences.chinese: 女孩子長大以後結果卻嫁到別人家給人家生孩子了。

sentences.english: Veronica reassures him that he's the man she wants to be with.
sentences.chinese: 維羅妮卡則盡力去安慰他，並保證她此生非他不嫁。

definition: to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a woman) to marry a man of lower social status/to marry down
to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
(of a groom) to escort the bride to the wedding ceremony/fig. to take as one's wife/to marry
to live as widow/to observe widowhood
